Name: Position damper centrally in pen. aperture as per system drawing (temp. supports/packers)
Tag 1: Position damper centrally in penetration aperture as per system drawing with temporary supports or packers.

Name: Position damper centrally in pen. aperture as per system drawing (IBS backing)
Tag 1: Position damper centrally in penetration aperture as per system drawing with IBS backing rod and temporary supports or packers.

Name: Galvanised steel casing positioned centrally within aperture is 0.7mm or greater gauge
Tag 1: Galvanised steel casing positioned centrally within aperture is 0.7mm or greater gauge

Name: Killargo fire rated mastic applied to gaps between fire damper & building element on both sides
Tag 1: Killargo fire rated mastic has been applied to the gaps between fire damper & building element on both sides.Gaps between the fire damper and wall no greater than 25mm.Ensure fill depth is 50mm. No evidence of cracking.

Name: Killargo fire rated mastic applied to gaps between fire damper/casing perimeter/building element
Tag 1: Killargo fire rated mastic has been applied to the gaps between fire damper, casing perimeter & building element on both sides.Gaps between the fire damper and wall no greater than 25mm.Ensure fill depth is 50mm.No evidence of cracking.

Name: Fasten 0.7mm thick steel mounting angles/brackets to damper with steel self drilling screws/pop rivets
Tag 1: Fasten 0.7mm thick steel mounting angles or brackets to damper with steel self drilling screws or steel pop rivets and to the building element with appropriate mechanical fixings at 200mm centre spacing or 1 per side as shown on system drawing.

Name: 0.7mm min. steel angles at least twice width of penetration gap
Tag 1: 0.7mm minimum steel angles at least twice the width of the penetration gap, fixed to damper casing with steel screws, bolts or pip rivets and fixed to wall with steel fixings at maximum 150mm centre spacing or 2 per side for casing lengths up to 250mm or 3 per side for casing lengths 251-400mm

Name: Ductwork connected to either side of casing with nylon bolts on flanges
Tag 1: Ductwork is connected to either side of the casing with nylon bolts on the flanges as per the AS1682.2 break away joint method. Bolts do not exceed an 8mm diameter.

Name: Access panel provided to conveniently access fire damper for visual/maintenance inspections
Tag 1: Access panel is provided to conveniently access fire damper for visual and/or maintenance inspections.

Name: Fire damper labelling in accordance with AS1682.2 placed
Tag 1: Fire damper labelling in accordance with AS1682.2 has been placed and clearly identifies the fire damper

Name: Fire damper mounting frame completely penetrates wall/slab?
Tag 1: Does the fire damper mounting frame completely penetrates the wall or slab into which it is installed?

Name: Damper mounting frame retained?
Tag 1: Does the damper mounting frame retained either, on both sides by means of flanges butted against the face of the wall or slab and fixed to the mounting frame or on one side by one flange only, fixed to the wall and damper frame allowing the damper body to expand without distortion to the blades?

Name: Penetration for fire damper has clearance on all sides?
Tag 1: Does the penetration for the fire damper have clearance on all sides equal to half the width of the flange used to retain the damper frame?

Name: Clearance filled with approved non-combustible compressible material?
Tag 1: Is this clearance filled with an approved non-combustible compressible material such as rockwool to the full thickness of te wall or slab involved?

Name: Method of attaching ductwork to fire damper ensure damper remains functional?
Tag 1: Does the method of attaching ductwork to fire damper ensure that the damper remains functional if the ductwork is damaged in any way and must allow the ductwork to fall away?

Name: Ensure convenient access to fire damper for visual/maintenance inspections
Tag 1: Ensure convenient access to fire damper for visual and/or maintenance inspections is provided.
